    Boat.BoatType
    Represents a Boat with various attributes such as type, name, year, make/model, length, purchase price, and expenses.

  • Constructor Details

    • Boat

      public Boat(Boat.BoatType type, String name, int year, String makeModel, double length, double purchasePrice)
      Constructs a new Boat object with specified values.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the boat (SAILING or POWER).
      name - The name of the boat.
      year - The year the boat was made.
      makeModel - The make or model of the boat.
      length - The length of the boat in feet.
      purchasePrice - The purchase price of the boat.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the boat.
      Returns:
      The name of the boat.

    • getPurchasePrice

      public double getPurchasePrice()
      Gets the purchase price of the boat.
      Returns:
      The purchase price of the boat.

    • canSpend

      public boolean canSpend(double amount)
      Checks if the boat can spend a specified amount without exceeding the purchase price.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to check.
      Returns:
      true if the boat can spend the amount, false otherwise.

    • spend

      public void spend(double amount)
      Adds the specified amount to the boat's expenses.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount to spend.

    • getRemainingBudget

      public double getRemainingBudget()
      Gets the remaining budget for the boat.
      Returns:
      The remaining budget (purchase price minus expenses).

    • getExpenses

      public double getExpenses()
      Gets the total expenses incurred by the boat.
      Returns:
      The total expenses.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the boat, including its details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string with the boat's details.
